hypothesis_content.title: Stablecoin-Denominated Exchange Pair Arbitrage During Stress
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes (VIX > 30 or BTC 1-day volatility > 15%), price discrepancies between USDT and USDC trading pairs for the same asset (e.g., BTC/USDT vs BTC/USDC) exceeding 0.3% create risk-free arbitrage opportunities that close within 30 minutes with 85% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During market stress, liquidity fragmentation across exchanges and stablecoin pairs creates temporary pricing inefficiencies. Market makers reduce inventory risk, widening spreads. Automated arbitrage bots are less active during extreme volatility, creating longer-lasting opportunities. USDT/USDC generally maintain tight peg even during stress.
entry_conditions: Market regime is STRESS (volatility regime indicator triggered)
Price discrepancy between identical asset on USDT vs USDC pairs > 0.3%
Arbitrage spread > estimated transaction costs (fees + gas)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Spread widens beyond 0.5% (indicating potential depeg event)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 20% of trades hit stop-loss due to stablecoin depeg events, or median time to convergence exceeds 45 minutes.
